title: Everyone thinks LP gain is related to MMR, explain this then.
body:
4 game winning streak, 1st game 20 LP, 2nd game 20 LP 3rd game 18 LP, 4th game 18 LP, 5th game (loss) -21 LP

How can it be MMR dependant and go 20/20/18/18? how does my MMR go down mid winning steak hmm? and then just after a winning streak i lose more LP than I lost on the last game of a 9 game losing streak... 

so tell me again how its MMR dependant??

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body:
You mention:
>Everyone thinks LP gain is related to MMR

So naturally I assume you see the hoards of boards about it.
Have you even read ANY of the boards you see about it? _**Every. Single. One. Gets. The. Same. Answer**_

I think it takes into account the MMR of the people you VS as well. So if you win against people with lower MMR you would get less LP. If you lose against people with lower MMR you may lose more LP?

This is just an assumption of mine. Do not quote me on this. It's just a trend I've noticed myself.

It seems to be that way, and even though the official info seems really vague it looks to be hinting at that. 

>WHAT DETERMINES HOW MANY LEAGUE POINTS I GAIN FROM WINNING A MATCH?
There is only one factor that affects the amount of LP you get: the perceived difficulty of the match, which is based on the MMR difference between the two teams. Being part of a premade group, kill/death ratios, and other statistics do not affect your LP gain.
[Source](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ#h2q3)
